Vaakanainen (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve Sunday, per CapFriendly.
Gibson left Saturday's preseason game because of an upper-body injury.

Moore will not be in training camp due to a lingering undisclosed injury, the team announced Wednesday. Additionally, the blueliner was designated for injured reserve according to the team's training camp roster.
Chychrun (wrist) was placed on injured reserve Monday.
The Coyotes held Keller (leg) out of Friday's preseason game against Vancouver for precautionary reasons, Craig Morgan of PHNX Sports reports.
Grzelcyk (shoulder) participated in a full practice Friday, according to Joe Haggerty.
Harrison will not be available for training camp due to an undisclosed injury, Joe Haggerty of BostonHockeyNow.com reports Tuesday.
Sheahan (undisclosed) is expected to begin the season on injured reserve, Lance Lysowski of The Buffalo News reports.
Pacioretty (Achilles surgery) was moved to the iinjured non-roster list Monday by the Hurricanes.
Fitzgerald (undisclosed) was placed on non-roster injured reserve Wednesday, Walt Ruff of the Hurricanes' official site reports.
McCabe (neck) took part in a full practice Friday, according to Tracey Myers of NHL.com.
MacKinnon left Saturday's practice after tweaking something, Peter Baugh of The Athletic reports.
Compher (undisclosed) should be ready when the regular season begins next Wednesday against Chicago, Adrian Dater of Colorado Hockey Now reports.
Landeskog (lower body) is doing off-ice workouts but has not yet resumed skating, Brennan Vogt of Colorado Hockey Now reports.
Gudbranson (lower body) will not play Saturday against the Capitals. Aaron Portzline of The Athletic reports.
Nyquist (lower body) is back at practice Saturday, Blue Jackets team reporter Jeff Svoboda reports.
Barton (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve Monday, per CapFriendly.
Walman (shoulder) remains on track to return in November, Ansar Khan of MLive.com reports.
Fabbri (knee) will not be ready to play until the calendar turns to 2023, Max Bultman of The Athletic reports Wednesday.
Yamamoto (undisclosed) practiced Monday, but his status remains unclear for Wednesday's season opener versus Vancouver, Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic reports.
Novak (illness) announced Wednesday he has beaten cancer.
Thompson (lower body) will begin the 2022-23 season on injured reserve.
Wahlstrom (upper body) expects to be ready for the Islanders' season opener on Thursday against Florida, Kevin Kurz of The Athletic reports.
Blais (upper body) is doubtful to play in Tuesday's season opener against Tampa Bay, Mollie Walker of the New York Post reports.
Zub (undisclosed) didn't practice Monday because of a minor injury, TSN 1200 Ottawa reports.
Farabee (neck) has been cleared by doctors for full contact, reports Sam Carchidi of Philly Hockey Now.
Couturier (back) will not require surgery but is still considered week-to-week, Bill Meltzer of NHL.com reports Wednesday.
Anisimov didn't take part in Sunday's scrimmage due to a lower-body injury, Bill Meltzer of the Flyers' official site reports.
Ellis (back) is expected to miss the entirety of the 2022-23 campaign with what could be a career-threatening injury, NHL.com's Adam Kimelman reports.
Blueger (upper body) practiced with the Penguins in a non-contact jersey, according to Pens Inside Scoop.
Donskoi (upper body) was placed on injured reserve Sunday, per CapFriendly.
Schwartz is listed as day-to-day with a lower-body injury, Kraken radio announcer Mike Benton reports.
Pitlick won't be available to play Tuesday because of an upper-body injury, Lou Korac of NHL.com reports.
Angello is in the concussion protocol following his early exit from Saturday's game versus the Stars, Lou Korac of NHL.com reports.
Washkurak will undergo wrist surgery Monday that will sideline him for 4-6 weeks.
Sergachev (undisclosed) will be held out of Friday's preseason game.
Cirelli (shoulder) was on the ice Thursday at training camp working on skills, reports the Tampa Bay Times.
Bogosian (shoulder) is on the ice at training camp in a red non-contact jersey, reports Tampa Bay Times.
Tavares (oblique) hasn't been ruled out yet for Wednesday's season opener against Montreal, Mark Masters of TSN.careports.
Head coach Bruce Boudreau is "hopeful" that Boeser (hand) can play Wednesday in Edmonton, Harman Dayal of The Athletic reports.
Garland (undisclosed) will not return to Friday's preseason tilt with Arizona.
Oshie (upper body) feels good to go, but he needs to be medically cleared first to play on Opening Night, Samantha Pell of The Washington Post reports.
Winnipeg was "being careful" with Dubois' minor lower-body injury Friday, Mike McIntyre of the Winnipeg Free Press reports.
Appleton is not at practice on Friday due to an upper-body injury, Scott Billeck of the Winnipeg Sun reports.
